question: 1. When creating a new security group, which of the following are true? (Choose two.)
options: D. Connections that are allowed in are automatically allowed back out.
C. Connections that are allowed in must also explicitly be allowed back out.
B. All outbound traffic is allowed by default.
A. All inbound traffic is allowed by default.
answers: D. Connections that are allowed in are automatically allowed back out.
B. All outbound traffic is allowed by default.

question: 2. You have a government-regulated system that will store a large amount of data on S3 standard. You must encrypt all data and preserve a clear audit trail for traceability and third-party auditing. Security policies dictate that encryption must be consistent across the entire data store. Which of the following encryption approaches would be best?
options: D. Encrypt the data prior to upload to S3 and decrypt the data when returning it to the client.
A. SSE-C
B. SSE-KMS
C. SSE-C
answers: B. SSE-KMS

question: 3. You are creating a bastion host to allow SSH access to a set of EC2 instances in a private subnet within your organization’s VPC. Which of the following should be done as part of configuring the bastion host? (Choose two.)
options: D. Ensure that the bastion host is within the same security group as the hosts within the private subnet.
C. Add a route from the bastion host IP into the private subnet into the subnet’s NACLs.
B. Place the bastion host within the private subnet.
A. Ensure that the bastion host is exposed directly to the Internet.
answers: C. Add a route from the bastion host IP into the private subnet into the subnet’s NACLs.
A. Ensure that the bastion host is exposed directly to the Internet.

question: 4. Which of the following are invalid IAM actions? (Choose two.)
options: C. Removing console access for the root account
A. Limiting the root account SSH access to all EC2 instances
D. Removing console access for all non-root user accounts
B. Allowing a user account SSH access to all EC2 instances
answers: C. Removing console access for the root account
A. Limiting the root account SSH access to all EC2 instances

question: 5. Which of the following statements is true?
options: B. You should never store your application keys on an instance, in an AMI, or anywhere else permanent on the cloud.
C. You should only store application keys in an encrypted AMI.
A. You should store application keys only in your application’s .aws file.
D. You should only use your application key to log in to the AWS console.
answers: B. You should never store your application keys on an instance, in an AMI, or anywhere else permanent on the cloud.

question: 6. Your company is setting up a VPN connection to connect its local network to an AWS VPC. Which of the following components are not necessary for this setup? (Choose two.)
options: A. A NAT instance
C. A private subnet in the AWS VPC
D. A customer gateway
B. A virtual private gateway
answers: A. A NAT instance
C. A private subnet in the AWS VPC

question: 7. You have a private subnet in a VPC within AWS. The instances within the subnet are unable to access the Internet. You have created a NAT gateway to solve this problem. What additional steps do you need to perform to allow the instances Internet access? (Choose two.)
options: C. Add a route in the public subnet to route traffic aimed at 0.0.0.0/0 at the NAT gateway.
A. Ensure that the NAT gateway is in the same subnet as the instances that cannot access the Internet.
D. Ensure that the NAT gateway is in a public subnet.
B. Add a route in the private subnet to route traffic aimed at 0.0.0.0/0 at the NAT gateway.
answers: D. Ensure that the NAT gateway is in a public subnet.
B. Add a route in the private subnet to route traffic aimed at 0.0.0.0/0 at the NAT gateway.

question: 8. Which of the following statements regarding NAT instances and NAT gateways are false? (Choose two.)
options: B. You must choose the instance type and size when creating a NAT gateway but not when creating a NAT instance.
A. Both NAT instances and NAT gateways are highly available.
D. You assign a security group to a NAT instance but not to a NAT gateway.
C. It is your responsibility to patch a NAT instance and AWS’s responsibility to patch a NAT gateway.
answers: B. You must choose the instance type and size when creating a NAT gateway but not when creating a NAT instance.
A. Both NAT instances and NAT gateways are highly available.

question: 9. Which of the following statements is true?
options: D. Traffic allowed into a NACL is automatically allowed back out.
B. NACLs are stateful.
A. A VPC’s default NACLs allow all inbound and outbound traffic.
C. Security groups are stateless.
answers: A. A VPC’s default NACLs allow all inbound and outbound traffic.

question: 10. You have changed the permissions associated with a role, and that role is assigned to an existing running EC2 instance. When will the permissions you updated take effect for the instance?
options: B. Within 5 minutes
D. The next time the EC2 instance is restarted
C. Within 1 hour
A. Immediately
answers: A. Immediately

question: 11. Which of the following statements is true?
options: A. When creating a new security group, by default, all traffic is allowed in, including SSH.
C. You must explicitly allow any inbound traffic into a new security group.
D. Security groups are stateless.
B. If you need inbound HTTP and HTTPS access, create a new security group and accept the default settings.
answers: C. You must explicitly allow any inbound traffic into a new security group.

question: 12. Which of the following statements is not true?
options: D. When creating a new security group, inbound HTTPS traffic is not allowed.
B. When creating a new security group, by default, all traffic is allowed out, including SSH.
C. When creating a new security group, by default, all traffic is allowed out, with the exception of SSH.
A. When creating a new security group, by default, no inbound traffic is allowed.
answers: C. When creating a new security group, by default, all traffic is allowed out, with the exception of SSH.

question: 13. How would you enable encryption of your EBS volumes?
options: B. Take a snapshot of the EBS volume and copy it to an encrypted S3 bucket.
D. Encrypt the volume using the encryption tools of the operating system of the EC2 instance that has mounted the EBS volume.
C. Select the encryption option when creating the EBS volume.
A. Use the AWS CLI with the aws security command.
answers: C. Select the encryption option when creating the EBS volume.

question: 14. What types of rules does a security group allow? (Choose two.)
options: B. Prevent rules
C. Deny rules
A. Allow rules
D. Inbound rules
answers: A. Allow rules
D. Inbound rules

question: 15. Which of the following are true about security groups? (Choose two.)
options: D. Security groups are stateless.
A. You can specify deny rules, but not allow rules.
B. By default, a security group includes an outbound rule that allows all outbound traffic.
C. You can specify specific separate rules for inbound and outbound traffic.
answers: C. You can specify specific separate rules for inbound and outbound traffic.
B. By default, a security group includes an outbound rule that allows all outbound traffic.

question: 16. Which of the following are not true about security groups? (Choose two.)
options: A. Allow rules take priority over deny rules.
C. You can specify specific separate rules for inbound and outbound traffic.
D. If there are no outbound rules, then all outbound traffic is allowed to flow out.
B. Responses to allowed inbound traffic are allowed to flow back out.
answers: A. Allow rules take priority over deny rules.
D. If there are no outbound rules, then all outbound traffic is allowed to flow out.

question: 17. Which of the following must a security group have when you create it? (Choose two.)
options: B. A name
A. At least one inbound rule
C. A description
D. At least one outbound rule
answers: B. A name
C. A description

question: 18. Which of the following is a security group associated with?
options: B. A network interface
C. An ALB
A. An ELB
D. A network access list
answers: B. A network interface

question: 19. Which of the following are default rules on a default security group, such as the one that comes with the default VPC? (Choose two.)
options: D. Inbound: ::/0 for all protocols allowed
A. Outbound: 0.0.0.0/0 for all protocols allowed
C. Outbound: ::/0 for all protocols allowed
B. Inbound: 0.0.0.0/0 for all protocols allowed
answers: A. Outbound: 0.0.0.0/0 for all protocols allowed
C. Outbound: ::/0 for all protocols allowed

question: 20. Which of the following are parts of a security group rule? (Choose two.)
options: B. A subnet
C. An instance ID
A. A protocol
D. A description
answers: A. A protocol
D. A description
